etymology.description: 大 (great) + 安 (peace) + 区 (district) = 'Great Peace District' (Da’an District).
etymology.interpretation: Literally 'Great Peace District'. An auspicious place name for a Taipei administrative district conveying stability and well‑being.
etymology.simplification: Only 區 → 区 was simplified in Mainland Chinese to reduce strokes; Taiwan keeps the traditional 區.

examples.chinese: 我住在台北市大安区(我住在臺北市大安區)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Táiběi Shì Dà’ān Qū.
examples.english: I live in Taipei’s Da’an District.

examples.chinese: 大安区有许多大学和公园(大安區有許多大學和公園)。
examples.pinyin: Dà’ān Qū yǒu xǔduō dàxué hé gōngyuán.
examples.english: Da’an District has many universities and parks.

examples.chinese: 我们在大安森林公园散步(我們在大安森林公園散步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài Dà’ān Sēnlín Gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.english: We take a walk in Da’an Forest Park.
